alert.note: Alert for Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 2:54PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Van Buren County through 345 PM CDT... At 254 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Bloomfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Leando and Douds around 315 PM CDT. Keosauqua around 335 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Lebanon, Van Buren County Fairgrounds, Keosauqua Airport, Lacey Keosauqua State Park, Morris Park, Utica, Mount Zion, Kilbourn, and Selma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
